Ecclesia

Ecclesia, named after the ancient Greek word for "assembly," is a web application that I developed as part of a Learning and Evaluation Situation (SAÃ‰) in my second year of my BUT. It is a democratic decision-making application that allows a group of people to ask open-ended questions, provide answers, and vote on the answers of others. The application was built using PHP and JavaScript, with a PostgreSQL database.

The application is divided into four parts: the "questions" section, where a user can ask an open-ended question that needs to be approved by an administrator before being published; the "proposals" section, where users can respond to the questions if they belong to the group concerned by the question; the "votes" section, where users can vote for the proposals of others; and the "results" section, where the voting results are displayed.

I developed this application as part of a group of four people. It was my first PHP project, and I learned a lot from it, both technically and in terms of project management. We used the agile method to manage the project and held regular meetings to track our progress.

A demo of the site is available at this address (with randomly generated questions and proposals): https://ecclesia.onirisme.net/
